status_legend.0: Normal Operation - The turbine is in normal power production mode
status_legend.1: Derated Operation - Derated power generation with a power restriction
status_legend.2: Idling - Asset is idling and waits to operate again
status_legend.3: Service - Asset is in service mode / service team is at the site
status_legend.4: Downtime - Asset is down due a fault or other reasons

scada_case.summary: Across the 6‑hour window the turbine spent most of the time in a downtime state (37 ten‑minute intervals), with only limited periods contributing to power production; when producing, output was fairly steady around 0.93 (std 0.12) despite moderate wind variability (mean 13.7 m/s, std 1.49). Operational signals show notable variability in rotating speeds (rotor rpm std 1.62; generator rpm std 179) alongside moderate average pitch (~8.2) and yaw misalignment (~8.6). Anomalies include an extreme wind speed maximum of 43.7 m/s and flagged power variability, while the average power residual stayed near zero (~0.01) and temperature averaged ~72.5.

mechanic_notes: Possible lightning receptor damage; inspect receptors and conductors.
fault_images_description: Lightning receptor tip shows charring and minor burn marks.

scada_case.summary:
Over this 6‑hour window, the turbine spent all 37 ten‑minute intervals in **Downtime**, with **no power production** despite generally strong and variable winds (mean 14.24 m/s, std 1.46, peak 27.4) and a **high_wind** tag. Operational signals showed relatively steady pitch (mean 7.98) and low yaw misalignment on average (2.2), while temperatures were elevated (mean 67.62) consistent with the **elevated_temps** tag.

The key anomaly is the persistent downtime concurrent with high wind conditions, alongside a non‑zero power residual (mean 0.0995) and low variability in rotor speed (std 0.0229) relative to generator speed (std 0.7666).

mechanic_notes: Potential leading edge crack; verify crack length and severity.
fault_images_description: Hairline crack near leading edge, extending a few centimeters.

Rotational behavior was generally stable, with low rotor RPM variability (**0.50**) but higher generator RPM variability (**56.4**) consistent with normal operating modulation. Notable patterns include a **positive average yaw misalignment (~8.16)** and a **negative mean power residual (‑0.0598)**, indicating output tended to run below the reference on average despite otherwise steady operation.

mechanic_notes: Routine inspection requested; no issues reported in SCADA.
fault_images_description: No visible damage; blade surface appears clean.

scada_case.summary: Over this 6‑hour window the turbine remained in **Normal Operation** for all 37 ten‑minute intervals, with consistently **near‑zero and very stable power output** (power_mean −0.0024, low power_std 0.0009) alongside a relatively **high average pitch angle** (pitch_mean 24.0). Wind conditions were generally low on average (wind_speed_mean 1.64, std 0.57) but included an **isolated high wind-speed spike** (wind_speed_max 17.2) that does not coincide with a notable change in mean power behavior. A persistent operational pattern is **large yaw misalignment on average** (yaw_misalignment_mean 67.6; tagged), with moderate variability in rotor speed (rotor_rpm_std 0.64) and higher variability at the generator (generator_rpm_std 83.3), while temperatures were steady around 35.0°C and the power residual stayed positively biased (mean 0.1147).

mechanic_notes: Check vortex generators for missing teeth or detachment; output appears affected. [added for eval: VG]

scada_case.summary:
Across this 6‑hour window the turbine is predominantly in **Downtime** (37 ten‑minute intervals), with generation effectively flat near rated when present (power_mean **0.974** with very low variability **0.0044**). Wind conditions are generally steady (mean **15.9 m/s**, std **1.16**) but include an extreme peak (**44.3 m/s**, tagged **high_wind**).

Operationally, rotor speed shows no variability (rotor_rpm_std **0.0**) while generator speed varies modestly (std **0.67**), alongside average pitch around **10.53°** and notable mean yaw misalignment (**9.58°**). A consistent negative power residual (mean **-0.1226**, tagged **power_deficit**) indicates measured power trending below the reference expectation during the window; average temperature is **68.6**.
